I know the last radio had port reliability issues. Has anyone had anything similar with this one?

We have had no issues - used during last year’s Champs and a few off season events.
Only non-Rio connection is one Orange Pi 5, and we have not been using POE from the radio.

More follow on - we added an Oculus to use QuestNav to the connections on the new radio - still no issues

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T14:05:20.286Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":20.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484922,"topic_slug":"are-the-ports-on-the-vh109-radio-reliable","display_username":"JBENJI","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28067,"username":"JBENJI","name":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/are-the-ports-on-the-vh109-radio-reliable/484922/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3545812,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T14:21:39.514Z","cooked":"

As an FYI the last radio was a general purpose radio with OpenWRT flashed onto it so we could adapt it to FRC networking easily. This required alot of effort and upkeep which just didn’t happen. As time went by drivers went out of date and got removed from mainstream support then lost; etc. the radio’s were EOL and showed their age for many teams. They were never designed for an FRC environment so we had workarounds like the grounding fix.

The VH-109 is very very different. For starters it was designed by FRC alumni who knew the environment well and went into a business before the new radio RFP was released. (@kiettyyyy you guys are seriously amazing and we are very privileged to have you as the radio vendor, keep up the awesome work!) The new radio also has dedicated firmware made for FRC. Good documentation explaining how it works and great pictures explaining how it operates (like the radiation graph is super useful for planning where to put the radio so it isn’t getting much interference from motors).

In short the new radio’s are nothing like the old ones, everything you knew about the old ones is not relevant anymore.
